says: Based on your answer. I would reccomend Workplace Standard First Aid.

Workplace Standard First Aid covers the following topics: Emergency scene management and PPE, Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and Automated external defibrillators (AED), Heart, breathing and stroke related emergencies, Wound care, head, neck, spine injuries, Environmental and sudden medical emergencies, Poisons
This certification is valid for 3 years and is available in Hybrid or In-person format.

says: Based on your answer. I would reccomend Emergency First Aid.

Emergency First Aid covers topics such as Emergency Scene Management and PPE, Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR), Automated external defibrillators (AED), Heart, breathing and stroke related emergencies, Wound care, head, neck, and spine injuries
This certification is valid for 3 years and is available in Hybrid or In-person format.

says: Based on your answer. I would reccomend CPR/AED Level C.

CPR/AED Level C covers topics such as Emergency Scene Management and PPE, Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and Automated external defibrillators (AED), Heart, breathing and stroke related emergencies
This certification is valid for 3 years and is available in Hybrid or In-person format.

says: Based on your answer. I would reccomend Marine Advanced or Marine Basic First Aid.

Topics covered: Marine scene management, PPE, Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and Automated external defibrillators (AED), Heart, breathing and stroke related emergencies, Wound care, head, neck, spine injuries
This certification is available in an In-person format only.
